title: Data requests block adding new folder

labels.name: bug
labels.description: A problem with current functionality, as opposed to missing functionality (enhancement)

labels.name: frozen-due-to-age

milestone.title: v1.14.0
milestone.description:
This release adds configurable device and folder defaults.

The output format of the [/rest/db/browse endpoint](https://docs.syncthing.net/rest/db-browse-get.html) has changed.

body:
When there are a lot of requests going on there will be a lot of activity on a folder's `defaultRealCaser` instance, with each operation taking the cache lock. This lock can be held for quite a while (because stat:s and listdirs), and there can be a lot of routines waiting for that lock. This in turn blocks the `dropCache` method which wants the same lock, and is called from `(*caseFilesystemRegistry).cleaner()`. The `cleaner()` holds the `caseFilesystemRegistry` lock for the duration, which then blocks creating new filesystem instances. Relevant traces:
